module_restrictions: College of Medicine does not accept senior and graduate exchange/visiting students. Only basic medicine courses are open to exchange/visiting students; the practicum courses are not open to exchange/visiting students.
Department of Anthropology has special Chinese language proficiency requirements; The courses are conducted in Chinese.
All practicum, GMBA, EMBA and EiMBA courses and practice course offered by the Dept of Chemistry are not opened for exchange students.
Some graduate courses are not open to undergraduate students.
visa_info: Students whose exchange period is one semester (or less than 180 days) will have to apply a Visitor Visa while students whose exchange period is more than 180 days will have to apply for a Resident Visa. Chinese, Hong Kong and Macau passport holders will need to apply for a Taiwan Entry Permit.

accommodations_info.University Accommodation: On-campus accommodation is not available to exchange students.
accommodations_info.Private Accommodation: NTU will not find off-campus housing for students, but it has a list of recommended resources here: https://oia.ntu.edu.tw/en/prospective-students/accommodation-kk9o.

university_description: The National Taiwan University (NTU) was established in 1945 with five colleges â€“ College of Liberal Arts and Law, College of Medicine, College of Science, College of Agriculture and College of Engineering. Today, NTU is a comprehensive university with eleven colleges offering a wide range of up-to-date disciplines and numerous research centres.
